intro: Heliophytum indicum, commonly known as the Indian sunplant, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Heliophytum indicum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience.
